summary: The Family First Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Key provisions include expanding the child tax credit, introducing a new tax credit for pregnant mothers, and simplifying the earned income credit. The bill also eliminates the additional exemption for dependents, eliminates the head of household filing status, denies deductions for state and local taxes for individuals, and excludes children from the dependent care credit. The changes are set to take effect for taxable years starting after December 31, 2025.
